author: Helen Yemm
title: How do I get rid of cuckoo spit?
text: Cuckoo spit solution Pat Heath from Norfolk asks "please could you advise me on how to be rid of unsightly cuckoo spit which is smothering my lavenders?" • When and how do I replant roses? I have looked online and found that they contain frog hoppers, but no information as to how to dispose of them. By the time my response hits the page the “spit” will have most probably disappeared, the little green bug-eyed nymphs that produced the fizz as protection against predators having turned into far less visible, brownish adult frog hoppers. • How do I save my lilies after an attack of lily beetles? Frog hopper inside cuckoo spit Picture: Alamy These may startle you as you deadhead or rummage around among your plants, but they don’t do much lasting damage and should not be regarded as major garden fiends. I agree with you, however, that since the patches of “spit” en masse are unsightly, some sort of action should be taken to get rid of them. • How to deal with fungal leaf spot It is tempting to aim a hose at them, but the little beasts will just produce more fizz. The best thing to do is pinch them off with finger and thumb (children who have a tendency to delight in the grotesque will often jump at the chance to help out). Follow @telegraph
